caption: This photograph depicts a large pile of discarded aerosol cans in a dry, rugged terrain under a bright blue sky dotted with puffy white clouds. To the left side of the image, there are additional peculiar details like a red barrel and other small clutter on the ground, hinting at an industrial or waste management setting. The scenery beyond the immediate foreground shows a sparse desert landscape with low hills in the distance, suggesting that this might be a remote or less populated area. The overall composition draws attention to environmental issues, possibly highlighting waste disposal challenges or pollution.
title: Pile of aluminum beer and soft drink cans are the raw material for building blocks of an experimental house being built near Taos, New Mexico. A total of 70,000 cans will be used singly and in building blocks of eight to build a two story house designed by architect Michael Reynolds. Unskilled labor and cheapness of materials will allow the structure to be built for as much as 20% less than conventional housing.
